perturbation.original_text:
1.  DEFINITIONS
     1.1. AFFILIATE shall mean, when used with reference to a party, any
individual or entity directly or indirectly controlling, controlled by or under
common control with such party. For purposes of this definition, "control" means
the direct or indirect ownership of at least 50% of the outstanding voting
securities of a party, or the right to control the policy decisions of such
party.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.  DEFINITIONS
     1.1. AFFILIATE shall mean, when used with reference to a party, any
individual or entity directly or indirectly controlling, controlled by or under
common control with such party. For purposes of this definition, "control" may mean
the direct or indirect ownership of at least 5% of the outstanding voting
securities of a party, or influence over the policy decisions of such
party.
perturbation.explanation: Original definition sets Affiliate control as 50% ownership of voting securities. Modified text defines control as potentially only 5% ownership and 'influence,' creating ambiguity about the control threshold. This impacts liability if an affiliate's actions are under question.

perturbation.original_text:
1.5. CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION shall mean, subject to the provisions of
Section 7.2  [EXCLUSIONS], all proprietary and confidential information of a party, including,
without limitation, trade secrets, technical information, business information,
sales information, customer and potential customer lists and identities, product
sales plans, sublicense agreements, inventions, developments, discoveries,
software, know-how, methods, techniques, formulae, data, processes and other
trade secrets and proprietary ideas, whether or not protectable under patent,
trademark, copyright or other areas of law, that the other party has access to
or receives. For purposes of this Agreement,
                                      1
* Represents confidential information for which Impresse Corporation is
seeking confidential treatment with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
the Co-Branded Content shall not be considered Confidential Information of
Impresse. For purposes of this Agreement, this Agreement shall be considered
Confidential Information.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.5. CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION shall mean, subject to the provisions of
Section 7.2  [EXCLUSIONS], all proprietary and confidential information of a party, including,
without limitation, trade secrets, technical information, business information,
sales information, customer and potential customer lists and identities, product
sales plans, sublicense agreements, inventions, developments, discoveries,
software, know-how, methods, techniques, formulae, data, processes and other
trade secrets and proprietary ideas, whether or not protectable under patent,
trademark, copyright or other areas of law, that the other party has access to
or receives. For purposes of this Agreement, the Co-Branded Content may be considered Confidential Information of Impresse only with a written consent. For purposes of this Agreement, this Agreement shall be considered
Confidential Information.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition explicitly excludes Co-Branded Content from Impresse's Confidential Information, but the modified clause introduces the condition that Co-Branded Content may be considered Confidential with 'written consent.' This creates a contradiction. Impresse is no longer sure what is and isn't confidential.

perturbation.original_text:
5.1. The Term of this Agreement shall begin on the Effective Date and shall
end fifteen months therefrom.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.1. The Term of this Agreement shall begin on the Effective Date and shall
end fifteen months therefrom, unless either party provides a written notice stating otherwise.
perturbation.explanation: While the original contract specified a specific term length, the added phrase permits either party to provide written notice to prematurely end the agreement term, creating a contradiction. It is uncertain when the agreement ends.
